habitat_description:
This species is found mostly in central and southwestern Texas, northeastern Mexico, and as far south as San Luis Potosi and Hidalgo.  Disjunct, isolated populations have also been reported in localities found in the Chihuahuan Desert, throughout the Edwards Plateau in Texas, and Coahuila borders with Durango (Good 1994; Jones and Lovich 2009).

Habitat of this species includes semi-desert arid regions up to conifer woodland areas. Bartlett and Bartlett (1999) reported populations in wooded canyons, rocky slopes, oak-scrub habitats, and rocky areas that surround springs and streams. Jones and Lovich (2009) reported sightings in shady, moist, slopes, wooded ravines, and limestone rock outcroppings. 

Found in semi-desert regions to pine forest. It occurs in oak-scrub and rocky habitats, particularly on rocky slopes, rocky areas along springs and streams, and wooded canyons. Found near yuccas, stotol, and small oaks.
